intro: Manulea platystigma, commonly known as the broad-stigma manulea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
